intro: Borreria haenkeana, commonly known as the Mexican borage, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers and its shrub-like growth habit. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Borreria haenkeana is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
